alert.note: Alert for Coconino; Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 30 at 8:44PM MST until July 31 at 12:00AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM MST/1015 PM MDT/ THIS EVENING FOR PORTIONS OF NORTHERN NAVAJO AND EXTREME NORTHEAST COCONINO COUNTIES... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of north central and northeast Arizona, from just south of Shonto, to the Hotevilla area. * WHEN...Until 915 PM MST /1015 PM MDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 841 PM MST /941 PM MDT/, Doppler radar indicated that only light rain continues over the advisory area. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area due to between 0.75 and 1.5 inches of rain earlier this evening. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Dinnebito Wash, Bitter Spring Wash, Moenkopi Wash, Begashibito Wash, Sour Water Wash, Shonto Wash and Oraibi Wash. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hard Rock, Cow Springs, Forest Lake Chapter House, Tonalea, Hotevilla, Hopi Reservation, Kykotsmovi Village and Navajo Reservation. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
